reviewText: This pedal is everything I could have asked for! Online demos don't seem to showcase just what this pedal can do. At 100% wet it makes the best ambient soundscapes, and at a more reasonable price than the Strymon blueSky. All in all a very great purchase.
GREAT REVERB PEDAL.LOW  SIGNAL TO NOISE  RATIO AND BEST REVERB TRAILS FOR THE DOLLAR.I HAVE  4 HARDWIRE PEDALS IN MY SET UPS & THEY ARE ALL WHAT I WOULD CALL PRO PEDALS.

Solidly made, and with two innovative / working-musician-friendly ideas that I don't believe exist in other products yet:

1) The rubber guard that fits over the knobs and protects your settings from movement.
2) Both a rubber and pre-cut Velcro backing for the bottom of the unit, easily switchable.

These guys did their focus group research!  Impressive -- it shows that they intend for their products to be used.

Room for improvement?  Only this, in my opinion:  The Velcro isn't strong enough to hold such a heavy unit reliably -- can you also provide a 3M Dual Lock template (or something similarly strong) for the bottom of the unit ?

They've jam-packed the unit with reverb features.  All sound good-to-great.

If you're on a budget, I don't think you can do better than this unit.  It's solidly made, covers just about anything you'd want a reverb to do, and the algorithms they use are excellent.
Best sounding chorus period
Beautiful sounds. A must buy. Good for anything from subtle ambience to full on swirling space noises.

It seemed ok at first until I realized how little fine control I had over the dry/wet ratio.  Now I'm sure putting it into a loop as opposed to in front of the amp would help, but I don't have any kind of amp loops I'm using at the moment.  Regardless, I have to have the mix knob a few clicks from off to sound right.

At 110$ new this pedal is a no brainer...actually its a bargain for a pedal of this quality. The plate is where it is at for me on this pedal. The only thing that kills this reverb pedal is a strymon big sky or blue sky...at the 350$ and 500$. This is a mono or stereo output pedal. To truly appreciate appreciate this pedal you need to hear it in a stereo setup where it opens of from a one dimensional reverb to a environmental monster. As an ambient guitarist this pedal has become a mainstay on my pedalboard replacing my holy grail.
excellent pedal, reverb options are great, the option of shimmer is very good. Fully satisfied with the purchase.

I chose this pedal after a thorough evaluation of many styles / brands / price ranges. The good news for reverb fans is that there are a great many very good choices at a wide price point. You can spend as little as $40 or well over $300. Youtube has demos on most of them so choosing is quite enjoyable and educational. The cheap ones are attractive from a price perspective but one must consider reliability along with functionality, versatility and sound. I wanted a reverb with several distinct voices and most certainly wanted one that provided the ability to create drones (in conjunction with my delay pedal), ambient swells AND had some of those awesome cool shimmer / halo / ghost / cavern voices - and there are many reverb units that do. I considered everything from a Dispatch Master to a Blue Sky to a Polaris to an Aftermath and many others. I am sure nearly all of them would have made me happy as all are great with their own personalities. Digitech's Supernatural has a good many demos which means a good many people enjoy it. I was impressed with everything I heard - from traditional spring, plate and hall to its dreamscape modes. I bought the S.A. and have not regretted it. Every mode can be set to be subtle and traditional (amp-like) and can be progressively ramped up to mind blowing extremes. It inspires you to create. It turns simple articulated chords into massive and beautiful colors. The volume swells you can create are a gift from outer space in rich tones and harmonics. It is an absolute blast. I haven't had it long enough to move it around extensively in my pedal chain so my experience to date is after distortion and modulation / before delay. At the current price point this cannot be beat - it competes easily with the Earthquaker line at 50-70% more $ and Strymon at nearly three times the cost. Some of the pedals may offer a few more features - and they better at the price - but this guy is well built, easy to use, is badass-cool looking and it sounds amazing to me in every mode. I seriously never knew reverb could be this much fun. Don't even think about not using a power supply.
Easily became one of my favorite delay pedals. Used for almost a year but decided to switch out for other pedals. would definitely buy another if i had room on my board or got a bigger one lol.

Truly the best plate and spring reverbs out there, warm and ample without killing your guitar's tone. I like to keep it on PHERB or SHIMMER on a low setting, AT 9 or 10 o'clock on the MIX dial, with LIVELINESS all the way up--just to add a little bit of glitter or jangle to my typically warm and fuzzy guitar tone. I highly recommend this pedal for ambient or atmospheric FX-driven guitar work as well as modest, light reverb for rock, blues, metal, punk, whatever you do. Can't go wrong. (Also: Get yourself a 9V adapter. I'm sick of reading two-star reviews about how the pedal eats batteries. All the good ones do. Get a daisy chain or a power supply already!)
Amazing reverb pedal. I am a sucker for clean, bright guitar sounds ... spacey stuff. Every setting on this pedal makes me smile.
On time, just as described, very solid built and most of all Amazon.com backs it..

This pedal is amazing - some of the richest sounds ever can be achieved by people like me, who turn knobs until they hear something they like.  Sturdy as can be, too - nothing is going to hurt this baby.  Can't recommend more.
Yes, this thing does everything I thought it should and would! Just right for worship guitar (lead). Highly recommend adding this pedal to your arsenal!

Thank god there's an excellent quality guitar pedal out there that does more than try to sound like a spring reverb.

I hate spring reverb.

I love this pedal.
love it
Wonderful pedal. Really unpredictable with its sounds. A huge improvement over my Boss RV-5
Packed with the legendary Lexicon reverbs.  That alone is worth the price. Recommended!
Great reverb pedal.
Great sounds, built like a tank
The second one I've bought I had to buy one for my bud it was such a nice pedal
Quick delivery, pedal is as expected
Listed as new, came opened and used.

This pedal is exactly what I was looking for it has a bunch of different modes that all sound great and all the modes are actually really versatile thanks to the three primary controls
The mix nob controls the amount of reverb there is compared to your dry signal it goes from barely noticeable, subtle effects to 100% reverb. Most players will probably keep it at about 12 o'clock but if you turn it up really high its great for ambient, spacey, music.
The decay affects how long the reverb lasts. It goes from what's probably more sustain than you really need to really short punch sustain.
The liveliness control affects the amount of treble the effect processes. This makes your sound, as the name suggests, livelier. This makes the affect fuller, and more obvious, it also tends to increase sustain, so the way you set liveliness affects the other two controls. This gives the controls more diversity than it initially appears to because all the controls more or less work together so one change affects several attributes. This is really nice for fine tuning your sound.
The different modes all have really nice sounds as well, not only are there the ambient modes but plate and spring modes that aren't ambient, this gives the pedal the versatility to be used in almost any kind of music
the plate mode is the classic sounding reverb you probably hear in most music, you can use this setting in almost any kind of music, I use it a lot for rock and metal.
The plate mod mode is basically the same as the plate mode with a little chorus added to the affect. I don't really use it that much because I use my own chorus sound but it's still a really good usable effect.
The spring mode is also the classic spring reverb effect we all know and love. I tend to use it a bit more than the plate mode but they are both great, studio quality, reverbs.
The ambient settings are stunning
Especially shine. It has a cascading pitch shift added to the effect that makes a really creepy, haunting, sound. I love this effect honestly if this was the only setting the pedal would still be worth it. If you turn the mix down it adds a really eerie sound to your guitar that isn't to over the top. And with the liveliness turned way up it makes some hauntingly beautiful sounds.
Supernova conjures up a spacey, strangely isolating, sound that unearthly beauty much like shine turning the mix down adds a really alien sound to your guitar that isn't to over the top. And with the liveliness turned way up it makes some crazy sounds.
The shimmer setting is basically the shine setting with chorus added, honestly I think this kind of ruins the effect so I don't use it much, but its still a quality effect.
Pherb is a hall reverb effect with heavy phasing added to it. I actually really like this sound. It's some what in between the "standard' reverbs on the device and the ambient settings. It has a really unique sound that can be used for both ambient stuff and normal music

All and and all you can make some fantastic, and diverse, sounds with this pedal. I would recommend it for any style of music and it's the only reverb I'll use for the foreseeable future.

**This review is coming from a synth/keyboardist's perspective.**

The Supernatural has some booming reverbs tucked inside its package, but are they all playable?  Mmm....That's another story...  I play in my church's praise band, so usually less is more, but the Supernatural has a lot of...wacky over-the-top modulation settings.  I got it for the shimmer, plate, and plate mod settings, though, and in those areas it hasn't really disappointed (although the shimmer gets really eerie when it's played with bass notes).  However, I've since stopped using it and it has been put on our electric guitarist's board, and she's found it perfectly usable, especially on the spring setting (I didn't mention the spring before because I just avoid spring usually--personal preference).  Would I get it again?  Mmm...Probably not, not because it sounds bad, but because it just didn't jive with me.

Wow this thing is beautiful. It gives you plain old reverb if you want but I particularly love the Supernova setting. Actually, all of the settings are amazing. Best reverb pedal out there for those who prefer more ambient and space filling sound rather than just the typical hall reverb. You won't be disappointed. Beware of the power suck this thing has though; it goes through 9Vs very quickly so if you plan on using this live make sure you have a power supply. I highly recommend this product. My friends love the sound of this pedal.

This is a really nice reverb. All of the sounds are useful and musical, in my opinion. The thing I would change would be the size of the unit and knobs. It fits nicely on my pedal board but the knobs are kind of small and close together. I wish the unit was a little bigger so the knobs could be  spaced out a little more. I would also like to see the tails on/off switch out from under the footswitch but that may only be my preference.

Great sounding 'verb'. The choices for different settings gives you many combinations with
the twist of a knob. I use this with my Strymon 'blueSky reverb and can really honestly say
they are both the best reverb pedals out there!

Does better spring reverb than Boss' 63 Fender Reverb pedal
All in all - not bad

I have been through an assortment of reverb pedals in my time including a EHX Holy Grail+, The Holy Grail was very nice- especially the spring setting. This pedal is outstanding, it matches the spring of the Grail but adds a plate reverb setting that simply is one of the best I've used. The other spaced out modulated/shifted reverbs also included are fantastic and very useable from subtle to wild. I love my Supernatural reverb pedal. It stays on most of the time on my board- coupled with a Carbon Copy analog delay, my ambiance effects are sounding great!  One thing to note,, it does not like to be 9vdc daisy chained with other pedals, it likes it's own power supply. Hats off to Digitech ---again!
Great natural sounding reverb. The shimmer is comparable to "big sky", I use it for long ambient decays during worship, awesome!
So awesome. It was really cheesy at first, but roll down the mix, and it's really amazing.
Great
Beautiful, lush, clear, ambient, sturdy...I mean, it's hard to say anything that hasn't been said about this pedal already. It's incredible. You'll love it.

It's the best reverb pedal I've ever used. Actually all modes are good, some are used more than others, depending on the type of music you play.

The only defect I find is that the power button is quite hard and the system does not seem very solid. It's also a pedal that stays on all the time ;-)
Built like a tank and sounds incredible...Especially in stereo!
I'm in love with this pedal. Amazing sound for ambient synth use. I was blown away by the tone. For the price, this is a must buy.
Excellent!
WHAT AN AMAZING SOUND!!

At this price, the Supernatural would be worth it for the quality plate and spring verbs alone. Having stereo ins & outs is a big plus for FX loops and creative routing options.

The more unusual verb types are fun and inspiring, especially for ambient passages or to add a bit of interesting depth to dry clean tones. Bring the effect level up too much, and it can sound too artificial and digital.

I'd like a little more control over the spring mode, but otherwise I'm pleasantly surprised by how much quality & variety you get for the price.
The pedal not on!!!!!

I listened to and watched many YouTube reviews of reverb pedals before selecting this one. I've had it for a few weeks now, and I'm very happy with it! It has excellent sound quality and features! Just to give some background, I play electric guitar for our weekly church worship service, and I wanted the ability to get some of the ambient reverb and shimmer effects commonly used by groups like Bethel, Phil Wickham, etc. So here are some of the pedals I was considering and what ultimately turned me away from each:
- BlueSky (awesome, but pricey and it lacked some of the other cool options like chorus/flanger/phase effects on the reverb signal)
- Boss RV-6 (very nice--this was my second choice, but the Digitech was slightly cheaper)
- Mooer Shimverb (seems to offer a lot of options, but the overall sound quality seemed slightly inferior)
- TC Electronic Hall of Fame (great standard reverbs, but lacked shimmer)
- Digitech Polara (cool sounds, but some of them are a little too 'out there' for what I needed)
Wow ! This is a great sounding Reverb pedal.

I go through a lot of reverb pedals. Hall of fame, Hall of fame mini, Lovepedal hsr-3, strymon blue sky, gfi specular reverb, polara, supermoon etc, and so far this is my favorite. It's plate sound is amazing, and the ambient features can be nice and subtle to in your face. tracking on shimmer isn't the best I have dealt with (blue sky wins for that), but it isn't bad. One down size is how large the pedal is. with side mounted input/outputs it takes as much of a foot print as the blue sky.
